result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla Mae Vansomeren Thornton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kayla Mae Vansomeren Thornton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kayla Mae Vansomeren Thornton was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Kayla Mae Vansomeren Thornton was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 3 and 5.
Concurrent to felony Probation.
Defendant to report to Probation no later than September 8, 2014.
Defendant eligible for expungement but must petition the Court.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: $243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF132.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF:  Kayla Mae Vansomeren Thornton appeared. Includes plea in 13CF305, 14CF132, 14CF263 and status in 13TR3593 and 13TR3753. Cases called at 4:17 p.m. ADA Hahn informs Crt of agreement. DE has been accepted to the St Croix County Drug Court. DE pleads guilty to Count 1 in 13CF305. DE pleads guilty to Amended Count 1 Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor and guilty to Count 4 in 14CF132. DE sworn. Court informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Court accepts plea, find factual basis and finds DE guilty of Count 1 in 13CF305, guilty of Amended Count 1 Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor and Count 4 in 14CF132. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Count 2 in 13CF305, Counts 3 and 5 in 14CF132 and 14CF263. Attornys waive PSI. DE has completed a Compas evaluation. Court waives PSI. Recommendations. DE makes statement. Crt orders:   

13CF305 - S/W:  3 years probation with conditions. Concurrent on each count but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
	
14CF132 Count 2 - S/W: 1 year probation with conditions, Concurrent to felony probation.

14CF132 Count 4 - S/W:  3 years probation with conditions. Concurrent on each count but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.	

Conditions of probation are: 

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Regular and random testing.
-AODA and follow any recommended treatment.  
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-DE to successfully St. Croix County Drug Court.
-Court costs on each count and supervison costs. Apply bond monies and any remaining balance payable through probation.  
-DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge. Payable through probation.
-DE to truthfully testify as a witness.
-Complete 20 hours of community service.
-3 months jail - STAYED to be used by the Agent.
-Huber granted for work and child care.

Court notes 92 days credit against any ultimate sentence. DE to report to probation no later than 9-8-14. Atty Smestad requests Crt consider expungment. Crt finds DE may eligible for expungement.
Filed by A. Perry. Re: The Def and Drug Court Eligibility. km

surety supplied his phone number. eif

ADDRESS INFO for Kayla Mae Vansomeren Thornton
Current: 880 Elm Street, Baldwin, WI 54002 United States  (Effective: 04-18-2014)
Prior: 640 Newton St, Baldwin, WI 54002 
Per Defendant's bond. eif

**BOND AMENDED**

Bond is to be Co-Signed by Lois Vansomeren.

DE to reside with Lois Vansomeren and is to keep her informed of her whereabouts. If DE is gone longer than 30 minutes, Lois Vansomeren to report DE to law enforcement.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Court authorizes DE to go with Lois Vansomeren the home to get her personal property.

Subject to random testing. 

DE report to Baldwin PD every Monday, Wednesday and Friday to report her address.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Xai C. or Tony X.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
